msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.l:
And it shall be,
if you do listen to the voice of the Lord your God to keep and
to do all his commandments which I command you
today, then the Lord your God will set you high — above all kingdoms
of the earth.

And
all these blessings will come on you and will catch up with you when
you will listen to the voice of the Lord your God.

You will be blessed
in the city, and you will be blessed in the field.

Blessed will be the fruit of your womb and the fruit
of your ground and the fruit of your livestock, the progeny of your great livestock,
and the females of your sheep.

Blessed will be
your basket and your bread-leavening vessels.

You will be blessed when you come in, and you will be blessed
when you go out.

The Lord will give up your enemies,
who rise up against you, broken, in front of you. By one way
they will come out at you, and by seven ways they will flee before you.

The Lord will command the blessing
for you within your abatises, and in all that you reach out your hand to, and he will bless you
in the land which the Lord your God is giving you.

The Lord will
raise you to be a holy people to himself as he has sworn
to you, if you keep the commandments of the Lord your God and walk
in his ways.

And all people of the earth will see
the land, that you are called by the name of the Lord, and they will be afraid
of you.

And the Lord will leave you
in prosperity in the fruit of your body and in the fruit of your livestock and
in the fruit of your ground, on the land which the Lord swore
to your fathers to give you.

The Lord will open
to you his own good treasure, the skies
to give rain to your land in its time and to bless
all the work of your hand. And you will give a loan to many
kingdoms, and you will not take a loan.

And
the Lord will put you among the superiors and not among the little, and
you will only be above, and you will not be below — if you listen
to the commandments of the Lord your God which I command you today,
to observe and to do them.

And you shall not turn from all the words
which I command you today, to the right or to the left,
to walk after the service of other gods to serve
them.

And it shall be, if do not listen
to the voice of the Lord your God to be watchful to do all
his commandments and his statutes which I command you
today, that all these curses shall come on you
and catch up with you.

You will be cursed
in the city, and you will be cursed in the field.

Cursed will be your basket and your bread-leavening
vessel.

Cursed will be the fruit of your womb
and the fruit of your land, the progeny of your livestock and
the females of your sheep.

You will be cursed
when you come in, and you will be cursed when you go out.

The Lord will send curses,
confusion and shortages at you in all
that you reach your hand out to do, until you are destroyed, and until you
perish quickly from before the evil of your evil deeds,
because you have forsaken me.

The Lord will make the pestilence cling to you until he consumes
you from off the land which you are coming to inherit.

The Lord will strike you with cold disease and
with fever and with inflammation and with gangrene
and with withering and with blight and with mould. And
they will pursue you until you perish.

And
your skies that are over your head will be like bronze, and the earth
that is under you like iron.

The Lord will give you out, before your enemies, broken.
By one way you will go out against them, and by many ways you will flee
before them. And you will be a shame to all the kingdoms
of the earth.

And your body will become food for the birds
of the skies and for the wild |animals| of the earth, and there will be no
one frightening them.

The Lord will strike you
with the boils of Egypt and with abscesses and with moist
scabs and with dry scabs from which you will not be able to be healed.

The Lord shall strike you with madness and
with blindness and with embarrassment of heart.

And
you will grope at noon as
the blind gropes in darkness, and you will not prosper in your ways.
And you will be just oppressed and plundered every day,
and there will be no saviour.

You will betroth a wife,
and another man will take her. You will build a house, and
you will not dwell in it. You will plant a vineyard, and, in the same way,
you will not harvest it.

Your cattle will be slain
in your sight, and you will not eat of it. Your donkey will be stolen
from before you, and it will not come back to you. Your sheep will be given
to your enemies, and you will have no saviour.

Your sons and your daughters will be given
to another people, and your eyes will look and long
for them every day, and there will be no strength in your hand.

A people whom you do not know will eat the fruit of your land, and all your labours,
and you will only be oppressed and crushed
every day.

And you will be driven mad
by the sight of your eyes which you will see.

The Lord will strike you with bad boils on the knees
and over your †bedheads that you will not be able to be healed,
from the sole of your foot to the top of your head.

The Lord will bring you and your king which you will set
over you to a kingdom which neither you nor your fathers know, and
there you will serve the service of those who serve
other gods, of wood and stone.

And you will
become destruction, a proverb, and stuttering among all nations
where the Lord shall lead you.

You will take out much seed to the field, but you will gather little, because
the kind of locust called arbe will finish it off.

You will plant vineyards and work them, but
you will not drink wine or gather |grapes|, because the
worms will eat them.

You will have olive trees within all your border,
but you will not pour oil, because you olive will wither.

You will beget sons and daughters, but they will not be yours, because they will go
into captivity.

All your trees and the fruit of your land
will be destroyed by an insect called čylčal. (A second translation
of the expression ‘the locust’:) (The enemy — who will come
letting his voice be heard — will inherit.)

The stranger who is among you
will rise up above you higher and higher, and you will come down lower
and lower.

He will give you a loan, and
you will not give him a loan. He will be the superior, and you
will be the smaller.

And all these curses will come on you
and will pursue you and catch up with
you until you are destroyed, because you did not listen to the voice of the Lord
your God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which he
commanded you.

And they will be in you for a sign and for a token,
and in your offspring forever.

Because
you did not serve the Lord your God with joyfulness and
with gladness of heart from the abundance of everything.

And you will serve your enemies which
the Lord will send at you in hunger and in thirst and
in nakedness and in lack of all things. And
he will put a yoke of iron on your neck
until he has destroyed you.

The Lord will in a way lift and carry
a kingdom over you from far, from the end of the earth,
the way an eagle flies, such a kingdom whose language you will be not able to understand,

A kingdom of fierce countenance which will not favour
the old and will not show grace to the young,

And it will eat the fruit of your cattle and
the fruit of your land until you are destroyed, who will not leave you grain,
must or olive oil or the progeny of your great livestock or the female
of your sheep until he has destroyed you.

And it will oppress
you in all your cities until your high and fortified walls come down
in which you trust to be defended in all your land.
And it will oppress you in all your cities, in all your land
which the Lord your God has given you.

And
you shall eat the fruit of your womb, the flesh of your sons and of your daughters
which the Lord your God has given you, in the oppression and in the distress with which
your enemies shall oppress you.

The
man †that is soft in touch among you and very delightful: his eye will look |with| evil
intent at his brother and at his wife in his armpits,
and at the rest of his children that he will have left —

From giving to one of them of the flesh of his children
that he will eat, leaving nothing left to him
in the oppression and in the distress with which your enemies will oppress you
in all your cities.

The †soft in touch
and the delightful woman among you who did not get used to set the sole of her foot
on the ground to stand on it because of her delightfulness and †softness
in touch: her eye will look |with| evil intent at the husband in her armpits,
and at her son and at her daughter,

And at her infant child that comes out
from her insides and at her children which she shall bear,
because she will eat them secretly due the lack of everything
in the oppression and distress with which
your enemy will oppress you in your cities.

If
you do not obey to do all the words of this Law
that are written in this book, to fear
the name of God, the honoured and awesome
Lord your God:

Then
the Lord will make your punishments and the punishments of your offspring astonishing,
great and continuous punishments, and
bad and continuous illnesses.

And he will bring back on you all the diseases of Egypt which
you were afraid of before them, and they will cling to you.

Also: every illness and every punishment
which is not written in the book of this Law: the Lord will bring them
on you until you are destroyed.

And you will be left few persons, because you were
like the stars of the skies for multitude: all this
will happen to you because you did not listen to the voice of the Lord
your God.

And it shall be that as the Lord rejoiced
over you to do good to you and to multiply
you, so the Lord will rejoice over you to destroy you
and to bring you to nothing, and you will be swept from off the land
where you are coming to inherit it.

And the Lord will scatter you among all
people, from the one edge of the earth even to the other edge of the
earth, and there you shall serve those who serve
other gods which you have not known, you and your fathers, wood and stone.

And among these kingdoms you will take no rest, and
there will be no rest for the sole of your foot, and the Lord will give you
there a trembling heart and misty eyes and
sorrow of mind.

And your life will be
hanging in front of you, and you will fear night
and day and will not trust your life.

At dawn you will say, “If only it were
evening,” and at evening you will say, “If only it
were morning,” because of the fear of your heart by which you shall fear and
because of the sight of your eyes which you will see.

And the Lord will bring you back into Egypt in ships, by the way
of which I spoke to you, “You shall see it no more.”
And you will be sold there to your enemies as servants
and maidservants, and there will be no buyer.’

These are the words of the covenant which the Lord commanded
Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land
of Moab, besides the covenant which he made with them
at Horeb.

app.note: A mistranslation based on the confusion of Heb. מִפְּנֵי ‘because’ with Heb. מִפְּנֵי ‘from before’. Repeated in a number of Karaim translations.

K: qararmaq; BHeb. חַרְחוּר ‘violent heat, fever’ (Klein 1987: 232; Koehler & Baumgartner 1985: 332–333), but cf. also Med.Heb. חַרְחוּר ‘fever’ (Jastrow 1903: 501), and Mod.Heb. חַרְחֻר ‘gangrene, plough-staff’ (Comey & Tzur 2006: 240). | Translated as ‘fiery heat’ in KJ2000, ESV, and as ‘burning’ by Friedman (2003). | Given that symptoms of gangrene may include a change in skin colour to black, we follow here the interpretation proposed in Jankowski & Aqtay & Cegiołka & Çulha & Németh (2019: II 266), where the word’s equivalent, i.e., EKar. ḥarḥur, is translated as ‘gangrene’. | TKow.01: qararmaq. | H: qararmaq. | C: ḥarḥur. | M: qararmaq. | R: qara ḥastalyḥ.
Heb. צְלָצַל ‘a species of locust, cricket’.
It remains unclear how does this addition relate to ‘the locust’.
Uncertain interpretation; the meaning of the word müǯešli is unclear.
